translated: Thus, although these scriptures use different words, there is no contradiction in their meaning.üîΩIn the commentary on the MahƒÅyƒÅna-sa·πÉgraha, it is translated as ‚Äúthe maturation of negative reflex.‚Äù

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par smin pa zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba yang dag bden pas de ltar bzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par smin pa zhes 'byung ba ni lo ts'a ba yang dag bden pas de ltar bzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: This is how the translator Ye-shes-sde presented it.

original: rgya gar gyi dpe nyid las de skad 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi dpe nyid las de skad 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not occur in the Indian text itself.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge Only explains two types of negative tendencies.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid la gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de gnyis sam /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid la gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de gnyis sam /
translated: Therefore, the treatise itself explains that negative tendencies are those two types or

original: yang na de nyid las 'byung ba'i las su mi rung ba nyid rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: yang na de nyid las 'byung ba'i las su mi rung ba nyid rab tu bstan te /
translated: they are taught to be the unserviceability that arises from them.

original: dper na snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis la zhugs pas sdug bsngal gyi dbang po spangs so zhes bstan pa /
analyzed: dper na snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis la zhugs pas sdug bsngal gyi dbang po spangs so zhes bstan pa /
translated: For example, it is taught that one who enters the two meditative attainments abandons the faculty of pain.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po nyid sang pa de mngon du gyur pa'i sa bon ma yin yang gnas ngan len zhes brjod pa bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin te /üîΩ'og nas gnas ngan len zhes @4a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po nyid sang pa de mngon du gyur pa'i sa bon ma yin yang gnas ngan len zhes brjod pa bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin te / 'og nas gnas ngan len zhes @4a * //
translated: Although the faculty of pain itself is not the seed of the manifest faculty of pain, it is called a negative tendency.

original: 'byung ba dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The term negative tendencies that occur below should be applied in the same way.

original: sa gnyis pa la kun du rmongs pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la kun du rmongs pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two types of delusion on the second level.

original: ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i sa pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i sa pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the obscurations on the second stainless ground.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the treatise Establishing the Cognition Only,

original: de las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig na re ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some say that confusion about subtle infractions is

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gang yin pa'o //
translated: one part of the innate.

original: las kyi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni de las byung ba'i 'khrul pa'i nyes pa'i las gsum po dag gang yin pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni de las byung ba'i 'khrul pa'i nyes pa'i las gsum po dag gang yin pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Confusion about the various destinies of karma is the three actions that are the faults of confusion that arise from that.

original: kha cig na re de las byung ba kho na mi rtog pa'i las kyi kun du rmongs pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de las byung ba kho na mi rtog pa'i las kyi kun du rmongs pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the confusion of the nonconceptual action that arises from that is the obscuration.

original: snga ma'i don ni kun du rmongs pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la kun du rmongs pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: snga ma'i don ni kun du rmongs pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la kun du rmongs pa zhes ston to //
translated: The meaning of the former is that the two sides of delusion are taught as delusion.

original: rnam grangs phyi ma'i don ni go rims bzhin du las slong ba'i kun du rmongs pa dang / las mi rtog pa'i kun du rmongs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs phyi ma'i don ni go rims bzhin du las slong ba'i kun du rmongs pa dang / las mi rtog pa'i kun du rmongs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the latter enumeration is that the delusion of instigating karma and the delusion of not understanding karma are taught, respectively.

original: gong du bstan pa'i rmongs pa de gnyis ni sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las log par sgrub pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i rmongs pa de gnyis ni sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las log par sgrub pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
translated: These two kinds of delusion taught above are the obscuration of wrong practice from among the ten obscurations.

original: sa gsum pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sa gsum pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: On the third ground, there are two kinds of delusion:üîΩthe delusion of attachment to the desire realm and the delusion of not completing the study of the form realm.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa 'od byed pa'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni gsum pa 'od byed pa'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The obscuration of the third ground, the Luminous, is the resistance to the elimination of the negative tendencies of those two.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: From the treatise Establishing Knowledge as Mere Consciousness:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The delusion of attachment to the desire realm

original: ting nge 'dzin mchog dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mchog dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the obscuration to the supreme meditative stabilization and to the wisdom that arises from meditation.

original: de sngon 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang lan mang du lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de sngon 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang lan mang du lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the desire realm attachment because it has frequently coexisted with desire realm attachment since beginningless time.

original: 'dir ting nge 'dzin mchog dang bsgoms pa las byung ba 'thob pas des 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs te /
analyzed: 'dir ting nge 'dzin mchog dang bsgoms pa las byung ba 'thob pas des 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs te /
translated: Here, one obtains the supreme meditative stabilization and the wisdom that arises from meditation, and thereby abandons the desire realm attachment.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas de'i rjes su 'jug pa de rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas de'i rjes su 'jug pa de rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it suppresses that which has followed it since beginningless time.

original: thos @4b pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thos @4b pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The obscuration to the complete perfection of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of hearing is the obscuration to the wisdom that arises from meditation.

original: 'dir gzungs dang thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzungs dang thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Here, it is said that it is the obscuration to the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´, to hearing, and to the wisdom that arises from contemplation.

original: kun du rmongs pa gnyis la mi gnas pa'i sgrib par bstan to //
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa gnyis la mi gnas pa'i sgrib par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the two obscurations to nonabiding are the two obscurations to the complete perfection of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of hearing.

original: sa bzhi pa la kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: On the fourth ground, there are two types of obscurations.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can gyi sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can gyi sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The obscurations to the fourth, the Radiating, are said to be: the delusion of craving meditative absorption, the delusion of craving the Dharma, and the negative tendencies that are their counteragents.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the treatise Establishing a Cognition Only, the delusion of craving meditative absorption is explained as follows:

original: 'dir ting nge 'dzin la sred pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ting nge 'dzin la sred pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here it is the craving for meditative absorption.

original: chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The delusion of craving the Dharma is explained as follows:

original: 'dir chos la sred pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos la sred pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Here it is the craving for the Dharma.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the obscurations to omniscience.

original: kun du rmongs pa gnyis spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa gnyis spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the two delusions are abandoned,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sred pas gnyis kyang kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sred pas gnyis kyang kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the two cravings that are mental afflictions do not arise.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di ni sgrib pa bcu las bzhi pa nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di ni sgrib pa bcu las bzhi pa nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, ‚ÄúThis is the fourth obscuration, the obscuration of the arising of subtle afflictions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig go /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig go /
translated: It is one part of the obscuration to omniscience that arises simultaneously with it.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bsdus shing mchog tu dman pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yid lam byas par yang dmigs pa'i phyir dang / mngon du spyod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phra mo zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bsdus shing mchog tu dman pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yid lam byas par yang dmigs pa'i phyir dang / mngon du spyod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phra mo zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is called ‚Äòsubtle‚Äô because it is included in the view of the transitory collection that arises simultaneously with the mental consciousness, and because it is a very inferior aspect, because it is observed as a mental activity, and because it is incompatible with manifest activity.‚Äù

original: don rnam pa gsum gyis shin tu phra ba'i don bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩdes sa bzhi pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gyis shin tu phra ba'i don bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o // des sa bzhi pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos la sgrib par byed de /
translated: It should be understood that the meaning of ‚Äòsubtle‚Äô is taught by three topics.üîΩIt obscures the dharmas that are the factors of enlightenment on the fourth ground.

original: sa bzhi par zhugs pa ni gtan du spang bar byed do //
analyzed: sa bzhi par zhugs pa ni gtan du spang bar byed do //
translated: But when one has entered the fourth ground, it is completely abandoned.

original: de sngon phal cher yid kyi rnam par shes pas rang gi dang gis bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dang gcig pa lta bur 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de sngon phal cher yid kyi rnam par shes pas rang gi dang gis bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dang gcig pa lta bur 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Previously, the afflicted view of the self and so on arose as if they were the same nature as the mental consciousness that naturally grasps a self.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ming du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ming du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are taught to be afflictions.

original: 'dir sa bzhi pa la zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thob pa des gtan spong bar byed pas /
analyzed: 'dir sa bzhi pa la zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thob pa des gtan spong bar byed pas /
translated: Here, on the fourth ground, through attaining the uncontaminated factors conducive to enlightenment, they are permanently abandoned.

original: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa yang kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro//
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa yang kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro//
translated: Therefore, the afflicted view of the self and so on do not arise.

original: @5a * // sa dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa bsgom pa ni 'jig rten dang mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: @5a * // sa dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa bsgom pa ni 'jig rten dang mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: On the first, second, and third grounds, the cultivation of generosity, ethical discipline, and patience are similar to those of the world.

original: sa bzhi pa la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thob pa dag ni /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thob pa dag ni /
translated: But on the fourth ground, the attainment of the factors conducive to enlightenment

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are supramundane because they are the antidote to the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba gnyis po dag gtan du bcom par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba gnyis po dag gtan du bcom par byed do //
translated: Therefore they permanently destroy the two afflicted views of the self.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang ldan par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang ldan par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that this mind is associated with consciousness and afflicted intellect?

original: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i ni zag pa med pa'i lam dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang / sa brgyad pa yan chad la gdod kun tu mi 'byung la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i ni zag pa med pa'i lam dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang / sa brgyad pa yan chad la gdod kun tu mi 'byung la /
translated: Because afflicted view of the self and so on are not compatible with the uncontaminated path and they do not occur from the eighth ground onward.

original: sa bdun pa yan chad la ni kun tu 'byung zhing nyon mongs pa'i gnas byed pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni rags pa yin la /
analyzed: sa bdun pa yan chad la ni kun tu 'byung zhing nyon mongs pa'i gnas byed pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni rags pa yin la /
translated: They occur from the seventh ground onward and they act as the basis of affliction, because this is gross andüîΩthat is subtle and because there is a sequence in their abandonment.

original: de ni phra ba yin zhing rnam par gnon pa la snga phyi yod pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni phra ba yin zhing rnam par gnon pa la snga phyi yod pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la /
translated: This is concomitant with mental consciousness alone.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa yang bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa yang bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The words afflicted view of the self and so on also include the obscurations to omniscience that have existed since beginningless time, craving meditative attainment and craving phenomena.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa ni sa gsum pa dag kyang 'phel bar byed pas sa bzhi par zhugs pa'i tshe gdod yongs su spong bar byed de /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa ni sa gsum pa dag kyang 'phel bar byed pas sa bzhi par zhugs pa'i tshe gdod yongs su spong bar byed de /
translated: Craving for meditative concentration and craving for the Dharma are also increased by the three stages, but they are completely abandoned when one enters the fourth stage,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not at all conducive to the factors of enlightenment.

original: sa lnga pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sa lnga pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: On the fifth stage, there are two kinds of confusion:üîΩconfusion about the non-objectification of all things, and confusion about the non-differentiation of the three times.üîΩThe counteragent to these is the path of meditative development, because it is the counteragent to the obscurations of the five stages.

original: 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pas kun tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pas kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni lnga pa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pas kun tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pas kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni lnga pa shin tu rgyal bar dka' ba'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The obscurations to the five stages have now been described.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The obscurations to the perfections

original: 'di ni go rims bzhin du 'khor ba las shin tu skyob dang ; mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni go rims bzhin du 'khor ba las shin tu skyob dang ; mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa'o //
translated: This is, respectively, being extremely disenchanted with cyclic existence and being devoted to nirvana.

original: sgrib pa gsum las 'dis ni lnga pa theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgrib pa gsum las 'dis ni lnga pa theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa nyid de /
translated: Among the three obscurations, this is the obscuration of the nirvana of the lower vehicle.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis 'khor ba las shin tu skyo zhing /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis 'khor ba las shin tu skyo zhing /
translated: It is being extremely disenchanted with cyclic existence and being devoted to nirvana through one part of the innate obscurations to omniscience.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mos @5b par byed pas theg pa 'og mas gnyis dang mtshungs par sdug bsngal gyis skyo zhing 'gog pas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mos @5b par byed pas theg pa 'og mas gnyis dang mtshungs par sdug bsngal gyis skyo zhing 'gog pas so //
translated: Thus it is similar to the two lower vehicles in being disenchanted with suffering and in being devoted to cessation.

original: des sa lnga pa'i tha dad pa med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: des sa lnga pa'i tha dad pa med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
translated: It obscures the path of nondifferentiation on the fifth ground.

original: sa lnga par zhugs pa na gdod spong bar byed do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sa lnga par zhugs pa na gdod spong bar byed do zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained that when one enters the fifth ground, one abandons it.

original: sa lnga pa la ni bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas bden pa bzhi po de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu tha dad pa med pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sa lnga pa la ni bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas bden pa bzhi po de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu tha dad pa med pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur bas /
translated: On the fifth ground, by cultivating the four noble truths, one enters the path of the nondifferentiation of the causes and effects of the defilement and purification of those four noble truths.

original: de'i phyir mi phyogs pa nyid dang / phyogs pa nyid kyi kun tu rmongs pa nyid spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi phyogs pa nyid dang / phyogs pa nyid kyi kun tu rmongs pa nyid spong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, one abandons the confusion of non-directionality and directionality.

original: sa drug pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sa drug pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: On the sixth ground, there are two kinds of confusion:üîΩthe confusion of discriminating the manifestation of the engagement of the compounded, and the confusion of the arising of many signs.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa mngon du bya ba la so sor rtog pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni drug pas mngon du gyur pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa mngon du bya ba la so sor rtog pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni drug pas mngon du gyur pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The obscuration of the sixth is the obscuration of the manifestation of the engagement of the compounded.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: From the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only,

original: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon du bya ba la so sor rtog pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon du bya ba la so sor rtog pa'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The delusion of discriminating the engagement of the formative forces is the apprehension of the existence of defilement here.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the engagement of the formative forces is subsumed by the side of defilement.

original: mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par byang ba la yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par byang ba la yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The delusion of the occurrence of many signs is the apprehension of the existence of purification here.

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the sign of purification that is taken up.

original: mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba ni mtshan ma med par bsgribs pa la lan mang du gnas par mi nus so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba ni mtshan ma med par bsgribs pa la lan mang du gnas par mi nus so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said that the occurrence of many signs is unable to frequently abide in the signless, obscured by the signless.

original: de la kun tu rmongs pa dang pos ni /
analyzed: de la kun tu rmongs pa dang pos ni /
translated: In this respect, through the first delusion,

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la 'khor bar 'jug pa'i sgo nyid du 'dzin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la 'khor bar 'jug pa'i sgo nyid du 'dzin to //
translated: one apprehends suffering and origination as the very entry to samsara.

original: kun tu rmongs pa phyi mas ni 'gog pa dang lam rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nyid du 'dzin to //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa phyi mas ni 'gog pa dang lam rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nyid du 'dzin to //
translated: The latter confusion is the grasping of the door of cessation and the path as having the characteristic of purification.

original: sgrib pa bcu las 'di ni drug pa mtshan ma rags pa kun tu 'byung ba'i sgrib pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgrib pa bcu las 'di ni drug pa mtshan ma rags pa kun tu 'byung ba'i sgrib pa nyid de /
translated: From among the ten obscurations, this is the obscuration that is the arising of coarse signs.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the grasping of the existence of the signs of affliction and purification by one part of the connate.

original: des sa drug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: des sa drug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
translated: It obscures the path of the absence of affliction and purification on the sixth ground.

original: sa drug par zhugs pa na gdod spong bar byed do //
analyzed: sa drug par zhugs pa na gdod spong bar byed do //
translated: When one enters the sixth ground, one abandons it.

original: sa bdun pa la @6a * //
analyzed: sa bdun pa la @6a * //
translated: On the seventh ground,

original: kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two types of confusion.

original: mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig tu yid la byed pa'i thabs kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni bdun pa ring du song ba'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig tu yid la byed pa'i thabs kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni bdun pa ring du song ba'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The confusion about the appearance of subtle signs and the confusion about the method of attending to signlessness are the resistances to the seventh stage, the Far-Reaching.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: In the treatise Establishing a Direct Cognition of Mere Awareness,

original: mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the confusion about the appearance of subtle signs is explained as follows:

original: 'dir skye ba po yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba po yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Here, the confusion is the grasping at the existence of the creator.

original: 'jug pa phra mo'i mtshan ma skye ba nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'jug pa phra mo'i mtshan ma skye ba nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /

original: 'di ltar rkyen rnams las skye ba dang 'gag pa'i 'jug pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen rnams las skye ba dang 'gag pa'i 'jug pa yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: In this way, the confusion is the grasping at the existence of the creation and cessation that occur due to conditions.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na 'gag pa zhes bsdus pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na 'gag pa zhes bsdus pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although it is subsumed under the term ‚Äúcessation,‚Äù

original: re zhig skye ba kho na smos pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig skye ba kho na smos pa yin no //
translated: here only creation is mentioned.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las mtshan ma med pa gcig tu gnyer ba'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las mtshan ma med pa gcig tu gnyer ba'i kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, the same text states that the ‚Äúdelusion that is the single-pointed pursuit of the absence of attributes‚Äù

original: 'dir 'gag pa po yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'gag pa po yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: is the apprehension of the one who ceases to exist.

original: lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan ma phra mo yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan ma phra mo yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is because it is the apprehension of the subtle attributes of the reverse order as existing.

original: ji ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan ma yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing /
analyzed: ji ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan ma yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing /
translated: How is it that the apprehension of the subtle attributes of the reverse order of dependent origination as existing is the delusion that is the single-pointed pursuit of the absence of attributes?

original: gcig tu mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar mi nus kyang /
analyzed: gcig tu mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar mi nus kyang /
translated: Although one is unable to apply oneself to the mental attention that is the single-pointed pursuit of the absence of attributes,

original: stong pa nyid la spyod pa mchog bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la spyod pa mchog bskyed pa'o //
translated: one generates the supreme practice of emptiness.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las 'di ni bdun pa mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las 'di ni bdun pa mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa nyid de /
translated: From among the ten obscurations, this is the seventh, the obscuration that is the arising of subtle attributes.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas so //
translated: Thus, it is the arising of the apprehension of the subtle attributes of birth and cessation as existing, which is one part of the innate obscurations to omniscience.

original: des sa bdun pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: des sa bdun pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
translated: This obscures the path that is superior to the signless path of the seventh stage.

original: sa bdun par zhugs pa na gtan du spong bar byed do //
analyzed: sa bdun par zhugs pa na gtan du spong bar byed do //
translated: When one has entered the seventh stage, one abandons it forever.

original: sa brgyad pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /üîΩmtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang ba kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa mi g-yo ba'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de / mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang ba kun du rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa mi g-yo ba'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: On the eighth stage, there are two kinds of confusion.üîΩThe confusion of striving for the signless and the confusion of mastery over signs.üîΩThe obscuration to the eighth stage, the immovable stage, is the confusion of striving for the signless and the confusion of mastery over signs.üîΩThe treatise Establishing a Cognition Only states that the confusion of striving for the signless and the confusion of mastery over signs are obscurations to the eighth stage.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa yang 'dir @6b mtshan ma la mi dbang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'dis kyang zhing dang mtshan ma'i phyogs gcig tu bsdus pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa yang 'dir @6b mtshan ma la mi dbang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'dis kyang zhing dang mtshan ma'i phyogs gcig tu bsdus pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The confusion of striving for the signless is the obscuration to the signless. The confusion of mastery over signs is the obscuration to mastery over signs.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chad gcig tu zag pa med pa'i lam rang gi ngang gis skye ba'i phyir dang / khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo ni kun tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chad gcig tu zag pa med pa'i lam rang gi ngang gis skye ba'i phyir dang / khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo ni kun tu 'byung ste /
translated: Because on the eighth level and above, the uncontaminated path arises naturally and the afflictions of the three realms do not occur, the subtle cognitive obscuration that is the afflicted intellect occurs.

original: stong pa skyes ba'i ye shes kyi 'bras bu de dang mi mthun ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: stong pa skyes ba'i ye shes kyi 'bras bu de dang mi mthun ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is incompatible with the result of the pristine wisdom that is born of emptiness.

original: de la stong pa skyes pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la stong pa skyes pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of the pristine wisdom that is born of emptiness is as follows.

original: stong pa skyes pa'i shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa phyis thob pa'i shes pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa skyes pa'i shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa phyis thob pa'i shes pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the pristine wisdom that is born of emptiness and the subsequent pristine wisdom and the meditative attainment of cessation that is accomplished by that pristine wisdom.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las 'di ni brgyad pa mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i sgrib pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las 'di ni brgyad pa mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i sgrib pa nyid de /
translated: From among the ten obscurations, this is the obscuration that is effort for signlessness.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gi mtshan ma med par bsgom pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gi mtshan ma med par bsgom pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o //

original: snga ma'i sa lnga po dag la ni mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgom pa ni mang la /
analyzed: snga ma'i sa lnga po dag la ni mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgom pa ni mang la /
translated: On the first five stages, the cultivation of the sign is more frequent,

original: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa ni nyung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa ni nyung ngo //

original: sa drug pa la mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgom pa ni nyung la /
analyzed: sa drug pa la mtshan ma dang bcas par bsgom pa ni nyung la /
translated: On the sixth stage, the cultivation of the sign is less frequent,

original: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa ni mang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par bsgom pa ni mang ngo //
translated: and the cultivation of the signless is more frequent.

original: sa bdun pa ni gcig tu mtshan ma med par bsgom pa rtag bar rgyun mi 'chad mod kyi /
analyzed: sa bdun pa ni gcig tu mtshan ma med par bsgom pa rtag bar rgyun mi 'chad mod kyi /

original: 'on kyang rtsol ba dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtsol ba dang bcas pa yin te /

original: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir /

analyzed: rang gi ngang gis mtshan ma dang bcas shing stong par mi nus so //

analyzed: rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa de yang sa brgyad pa la rtsol ba'i lam med pa'i phyir /

original: sa brgyad par zhugs pa na gtan spong bar byed de /
analyzed: sa brgyad par zhugs pa na gtan spong bar byed de /

original: de gtan du spong ba'i phyir dbang rnam pa gnyis kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gtan du spong ba'i phyir dbang rnam pa gnyis kyang thob par 'gyur ro //

original: sa dgu pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: On the ninth stage, there are two kinds of confusion:

translated: confusion about the mastery of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of wisdom and eloquence with regard to the infinite teaching of the Dharma and the infinite words and letters of the Dharma, and confusion about the mastery of eloquence.üîΩAnd their negative reflex is the resistance.

original: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: In the treatise Establishing the Cognition Only,

original: chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge dpag tu med pa @7a * //
analyzed: chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge dpag tu med pa @7a * //
translated: the infinite teaching of the Dharma and the infinite words and letters of the Dharma,

original: dang ; gong nas gong du shes rab dang / spobs pa'i gzungs kyi dbang la kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang ; gong nas gong du shes rab dang / spobs pa'i gzungs kyi dbang la kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: chos bstan pa dang dpag tu med pa'i gzungs kyi dbang zhes bya ba ni so so yang dag par rig pa ste /

analyzed: chos kyi tshig dang yi ge dpag tu med pa'i gzungs kyi dbang zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa ste /

original: gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa'i gzungs kyi dbang zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa'i gzungs kyi dbang zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ste /

translated: Because, by means of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of the etymological interpretation of the sounds and words, he has attained mastery over the sounds and words, and can reveal all sounds and words within a single sound and word.

original: spobs pa la dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩspobs pa la dbang ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: spobs pa la dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba la / spobs pa la dbang ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Mastery over eloquence is called ‚Äúdelusion.üîΩ‚Äù

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /

original: dbang po legs par rtogs shing chos bstan pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po legs par rtogs shing chos bstan pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has understood the faculties well and is skilled in teaching the Dharma.

original: kun tu rmongs pa la dbang rnam pa bzhi po de dag la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa de ni sa dgu pa'i sgrib pas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa la dbang rnam pa bzhi po de dag la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa de ni sa dgu pa'i sgrib pas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las 'di ni dgu pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la ma mos pa'i sgrib pa nyid de /

analyzed: des sa dgu pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la sgrib par byed /

analyzed: sa dgu par zhugs pa na gtan du spong bar byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: When he has entered the ninth stage, he abandons it forever.

original: sa bcu pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la kun tu rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: On the tenth stage, there are two kinds of confusion:üîΩconfusion about the great superknowledges, and confusion about understanding the subtle secrets of the buddhas.

original: mngon par shes pa chen po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug pa shin tu phra mo khong du chud pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni bcu pa @7b chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa chen po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug pa shin tu phra mo khong du chud pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni bcu pa @7b chos kyi sprin gyi sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //

analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /

analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa chen po la kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'dir ni bya ba'i dngos po'i las la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug pa shin tu phra mo khong du chud pa la kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'dir chos chen po'i ye shes kyi sprin dang / yongs su sba bar bya ba la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa bcu las ni chos rnams la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa nyid de /

analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis chos rnams la dbang thob par mi byed pas so //

analyzed: des sa bcu pa'i chos chen po'i ye shes kyi sprin dang / yongs su sbas pa las 'byung ba'i bya ba'i dngos po dag la sgrib par byed de /
translated: It acts as an obscuration to the activity of the bodhisattvas that consists in the great Dharma of the tenth spiritual level, the cloud of Dharma, and the protection of all.

original: sa bcu par zhugs pa na gtan du spong ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bcu par zhugs pa na gtan du spong ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: When one enters the tenth stage, one abandons them forever.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la kun tu rmongs pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la kun tu rmongs pa gnyis yod de /
translated: On the stage of the TathƒÅgata there are two kinds of confusion.üîΩThe confusion of a subtle attachment to all objects of knowledge and the confusion of a subtle resistance are the negative tendencies that are adverse to that stage.

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa shin tu phra mo kun tu rmongs pa dang / thogs pa phra mo kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: In the treatise Establishing the Cognition Only,

analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa shin tu phra mo kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'dir shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo bstan pa gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: thogs pa shin tu phra mo kun tu rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sa bon gang yin pa thams cad de /

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: de byang chub thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa cig car spangs nas dgra bcom pa dang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de byang chub thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa cig car spangs nas dgra bcom pa dang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang / byang chub chen po thob par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub ba las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub ba las /

analyzed: 'dir lhan cig @8a * //

original: rigs kyi bu kun tu rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / gnas ngan len bcu gcig po de dag gi phyir sa rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa rmongs pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i dgos pa ston to //

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: spyi dang bye brag ste /

original: 'di ni dang po spyir bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po spyir bsngags pa brjod pa'o //

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: yang na shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa gang yin pa de ni phan yon che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa gang yin pa de ni phan yon che ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar kun tu rmongs pa'i dra ba chen po rab tu dral zhing de ltar gnas ngan len gyi thibs po las yang dag par 'das nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du thob par bgyid pa lags
translated: How is it that bodhisattvas, having thus torn asunder the great net of delusion and having thus transcended the thickets of evil propensities, realize supreme perfect enlightenment?

analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa rnams bral ba dang / gnas ngan len las yang dag par 'das pa dang ; byang chub mngon du byed pa ste /

analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad bstan pa dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis byang chub kyi yon tan brjod pa'o / // / bam po lnga bcu drug pa /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

translated: This is the request of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di ltar sa bcu gcig po de dag rnam pa du dag gis rnam par gzhag pa @9a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bcu gcig po de dag rnam pa du dag gis rnam par gzhag pa @9a * //
translated: In what ways are those eleven stages established?

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las /

analyzed: byang chub @19b sems dpa'i skye ba len pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bshad de /

analyzed: bstan bcos de las yid la byed pa yang dag par sgrub pa de yang chos spyod pa rnam pa bcus yongs su 'dzin pas so zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Because that treatise says, ‚ÄúThat correct practice of attention is also embraced by ten Dharma activities.‚Äù

analyzed: byang chub sems kyi rjes su srung ba zhes bya ba ni gsum pa byang chub kyi sems srung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of guarding the Thought of Enlightenment is taught in the third verse.

original: yongs su mi nyams par srung ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems srung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams par srung ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems srung ba zhes bya'o //

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rgya cher bshad pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mdo las @29b bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rgya cher bshad pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mdo las @29b bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment should be understood according to the Sutra on the Generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems kyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive expression of the praise of the Thought of Enlightenment is according to the Holy Akasagarbhasutra.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i mtshan nyid ston te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i mtshan nyid ston te /
translated: The characteristic of relying on the spiritual teacher is taught in the fourth verse.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the Yogacaryabhami:

original: yan lag brgyad dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: When they have these eight qualities, bodhisattvas' spiritual masters are to be known as being completely perfect.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas shing ma nyams pa dang / skyon med par byed pas tshul khrims la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas shing ma nyams pa dang / skyon med par byed pas tshul khrims la gnas pa yin /
translated: They are morally disciplined, in that they are abiding in the bodhisattva vow and are not impaired or deficient.

original: blo ma byang ba ma yin pas mang du thos pa yin /üîΩbsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yang rung ba thob cing /
analyzed: blo ma byang ba ma yin pas mang du thos pa yin / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba gang yang rung ba thob cing /
translated: They are learned, in that their minds are not untrained.üîΩThey are wise, in that they have attained any of the virtues that come from meditation

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pas rtog pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pas rtog pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: and have attained serenity and insight.

original: snying rje dang ldan na snying brtse ba yin te /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan na snying brtse ba yin te /
translated: They are compassionate, in that they are full of love.

original: tshe 'di la rang gi bde bar gnas pa yal bar bor nas /
analyzed: tshe 'di la rang gi bde bar gnas pa yal bar bor nas /
translated: They are dedicated, in that they have given up their own happiness in this life

original: gzhan dag la sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag la sbyor ba yin /
translated: and are devoted to others.

original: gzhan dag la chos ston pa na bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pas dran pa dang / spobs pa nyams pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la chos ston pa na bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pas dran pa dang / spobs pa nyams pa med pas 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: They are fearless, in that they are not afraid of being embarrassed and so have neither lost their memory nor their eloquence when teaching the Dharma to others.

original: gzhan dag gis brnyas pa rnams dang / 'phya ba dang / bsting ba dang / ngan du brjod pa dang / ngan pa 'ongs pa la sogs pa mi 'dod pa'i tshig gi lam rnams dang / sems can gyi log par zhugs pa rnam pa sna tshogs bzod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brnyas pa rnams dang / 'phya ba dang / bsting ba dang / ngan du brjod pa dang / ngan pa 'ongs pa la sogs pa mi 'dod pa'i tshig gi lam rnams dang / sems can gyi log par zhugs pa rnam pa sna tshogs bzod pa yin /
translated: It is to be patient with the various wrongdoings of sentient beings, with the unpleasant words and verbal actions of others, with the various kinds of contempt, ridicule, slander, and insults that people subject you to, and with the various kinds of unwanted situations that arise.

original: 'khor bzhi po dag la chos ston pa la stobs dang ldan zhing ngal ba med pas yongs su mi skyo ba yin /
analyzed: 'khor bzhi po dag la chos ston pa la stobs dang ldan zhing ngal ba med pas yongs su mi skyo ba yin /
translated: It is to be indefatigable in teaching the Dharma to the four kinds of followers, being strong and not tiring.

original: tshig gi chos nyid las ma nyams shing gsal ba tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pas dge ba'i tshig dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshig gi chos nyid las ma nyams shing gsal ba tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pas dge ba'i tshig dang ldan pa yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: It is to have virtuous speech, because it is not divorced from the nature of speech and is clear and has the function of speech.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi tshig gi mdo dang sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bsngags pa rgya cher brjod pa ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi tshig gi mdo dang sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive praise of spiritual teachers should be understood according to the sutra of the Questions of Ratnachuda and the sutra of the Great Collection of Jewels.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva's reliance on the spiritual master is to be understood as complete in four ways:

original: dus dus su nad g-yog dang / tha mal pa'i g-yog bya ba dang / byams pa dang / gus pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan @30a * //üîΩpa dang / dus dus su gus par smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / 'dud par bya ba dang / mchod pa bya ba dang / chos dang mthun pa'i gos dang / zas dang /
analyzed: dus dus su nad g-yog dang / tha mal pa'i g-yog bya ba dang / byams pa dang / gus pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan @30a * // pa dang / dus dus su gus par smra ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba dang / 'dud par bya ba dang / mchod pa bya ba dang / chos dang mthun pa'i gos dang / zas dang /
translated: by service with love, respect, and joy, and by service in sickness and in ordinary times;üîΩby service with Dharma robes, alms, bedding, seat, remedies for illness, and requisites;

original: mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gso sman dang / yo byad sbyin pas mchod pa dang / gnas bcas nas yang dag par gzud pa dang / rnam par gzud pas chos dang mthun pas don la dbang byed la /
analyzed: mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gso sman dang / yo byad sbyin pas mchod pa dang / gnas bcas nas yang dag par gzud pa dang / rnam par gzud pas chos dang mthun pas don la dbang byed la /
translated: by service in leading to the Dharma and in guiding, and by service in the power of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: rnam par mi g-yo zhing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'chags pa dang / dus dus su shes par bya ba'i bsam pas drung du 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / dri ba dang nyan pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yo zhing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'chags pa dang / dus dus su shes par bya ba'i bsam pas drung du 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / dri ba dang nyan pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is to be unwaveringly correct, to be open to correction, and to approach the teacher from time to time with the intention of learning. It is to serve the teacher, to ask questions, and to listen.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa rgyun mi 'chad par nan tan gyis sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa rgyun mi 'chad par nan tan gyis sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: One should train in the uninterrupted application to virtue. This is the fifth characteristic, the uninterrupted practice of earnest practice.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the Mahayana-samgraha:

original: rtag par rgyun du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe practice of the six perfections is completed in the manner of uninterrupted continuity.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rgyun ring po dang / bar chad med pa dang / gus pa dang / lus med pa'i bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi las bar chad med pa'i bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun ring po dang / bar chad med pa dang / gus pa dang / lus med pa'i bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi las bar chad med pa'i bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: This is from among the four kinds of meditation: long-term, uninterrupted, respectful, and non-bodily.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni yang yan lag gi sems kyis bsnan te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni yang yan lag gi sems kyis bsnan te /
translated: In the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only, the author adds the branch consciousnesses to the above list.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lngar byas nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lngar byas nas /
translated: He then teaches that there are five kinds of meditation.

original: mdo 'di nyid kyi don ston to //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid kyi don ston to //
translated: He explains the meaning of this sutra.

original: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga bstan pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub par 'dod pas mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga phun sum tshogs par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga bstan pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub par 'dod pas mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga phun sum tshogs par bya dgos te /
translated: The teaching of the five characteristics is for those who wish to practice the six perfections. They must perfect the five characteristics.

original: dang po ni gsung rab kyi yan lag la mos pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni gsung rab kyi yan lag la mos pa ste /
translated: The first is faith in the branches of the scriptures.

original: gal te bstan pa la ma brten na spyod pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te bstan pa la ma brten na spyod pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not rely on the teaching, it will not be practice.

original: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa'i gsung rab la mngon par yid ches par gyur nas chos spyod pa rnam pa bcus shes rab gsum skyed par byed de spyod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa'i gsung rab la mngon par yid ches par gyur nas chos spyod pa rnam pa bcus shes rab gsum skyed par byed de spyod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is the one who, having gained faith in the teachings of the noble ones, generates the three wisdoms by means of the ten practices of Dharma, because he is of the nature of practice.

original: gsum pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rjes su bsrungs nas mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rjes su bsrungs nas mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third is the one who, having guarded the roots of virtue, makes them not decline.

original: bzhi pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the one who relies on a spiritual friend,

original: rkyen khyad par du 'phags pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen khyad par du 'phags pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he depends on special conditions.

original: lnga pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom pa ste /
translated: The fifth is the one who meditates uninterruptedly,

original: myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: myur du yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: because he quickly perfects it.

original: bstan @30b bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bsgom pa rnam pa lnga zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bstan @30b bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bsgom pa rnam pa lnga zhes bshad de /
translated: The treatise Summary of the Great Vehicle explains five types of meditation.

original: kun tu spyod pa las sbyor bas bsgom pa dang / mos pas bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pas bsgom pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas bsgom pa dang / bya ba bsgrub pas bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa las sbyor bas bsgom pa dang / mos pas bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pas bsgom pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas bsgom pa dang / bya ba bsgrub pas bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said that there are five kinds of meditation: meditation through application, meditation through aspiration, meditation through mental attention, meditation through skill in means, and meditation through the accomplishment of action.üîΩMoreover, the Compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bsgom pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bsgom pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga po 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, meditation is of five kinds:üîΩmeditation based on the retention of stability, meditation based on mental attention, meditation based on mental aspiration, meditation based on skill in means, and meditation based on power.

original: gnas pa yongs su 'dzin pa la brten pa la bsgom pa dang / yid la brten pa la bsten pa'i bsgom pa dang / yid kyi mos pa la brten pa'i bsgom pa dang / thabs la brten pa'i bsgom pa dang / dbang la brten pa'i bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung bas rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gnas pa yongs su 'dzin pa la brten pa la bsgom pa dang / yid la brten pa la bsten pa'i bsgom pa dang / yid kyi mos pa la brten pa'i bsgom pa dang / thabs la brten pa'i bsgom pa dang / dbang la brten pa'i bsgom pa'o zhes 'byung bas rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: This is taught extensively in that text.

original: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not cite them here.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Avalokite≈õvara again addressed the Bhagavat:üîΩBhagavat, why are those bases of training only designated as six?

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bslab par bgyi ba'i gzhi de dag grangs drug kho nar gdags pa mdzad lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bslab par bgyi ba'i gzhi de dag grangs drug kho nar gdags pa mdzad lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on, it teaches the fifth chapter called The Gate of Teaching the Non-Increase and Non-Decrease of the Perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu po yod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu po yod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Those ten types of perfections are also divided into two types.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po dag gi grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po dag gi grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches the non-increase and non-decrease of the number of the six perfections, and it teaches the non-increase and non-decrease of the number of the four perfections.

original: dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first also has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan gsungs pa ste /
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po drug kho na nyid du nges pa'i gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po drug kho na nyid du nges pa'i gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question about the certainty of just the first six.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Avalokite≈õvara:

original: rigs kyi bu rgyu rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyu rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: Son of good family, it is for two kinds of causes and conditions. This shows the second, the TathƒÅgata's correct answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: This also has four parts:

original: grangs smos pa dang / rgyan gnyis so sor bstan pa dang / rkyen rnam pa gnyis so sor bsdu ba dang / rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: grangs smos pa dang / rgyan gnyis so sor bstan pa dang / rkyen rnam pa gnyis so sor bsdu ba dang / rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: stating the number, teaching the two ornaments individually, summarizing the two kinds of conditions individually, and explaining in detail.

original: 'di ni dang po grangs smos nas rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir grangs de ltar nges par 'gyur ro @31a * //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po grangs smos nas rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir grangs de ltar nges par 'gyur ro @31a * //
translated: This is the first, stating the number. For two kinds of causes and conditions, the number is determined in that way.

original: zhes mdor lan gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes mdor lan gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the brief answer.

original: mtshams rnam par grol ba'i ma do las ni dngos po gnyis te zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par grol ba'i ma do las ni dngos po gnyis te zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the intermediate state of liberation from the boundaries, there are two things.

original: sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rkyen rnam pa gnyis so sor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rkyen rnam pa gnyis so sor bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the second pair of conditions.

original: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //

original: phyi ma gsum ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gsum pa dang po dang phyi ma'i rnam pa gsum rkyen gnyis su so sor bsdu ba ston to //
analyzed: phyi ma gsum ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gsum pa dang po dang phyi ma'i rnam pa gsum rkyen gnyis su so sor bsdu ba ston to //
translated: This is the third, the division of the first and latter triads into two pairs of conditions.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa gsum ni sems can la phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa gsum ni sems can la phan 'dogs par byed do //

analyzed: brtson 'grus la sogs pa gsum ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pas so //
translated: The three of effort, etc. are the antidotes to the defilements.

original: dang po gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pas ni yo byad nye bar bsgrubs nas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: dang po gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pas ni yo byad nye bar bsgrubs nas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs so //
translated: The first three benefit sentient beings. Thus, bodhisattvas benefit sentient beings by giving, since they provide them with material necessities.

original: tshul khrims ni gnod pa dang / phongs pa dang / rnam par tho 'tshams pa nye bar mi bsgrub pas sems can la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni gnod pa dang / phongs pa dang / rnam par tho 'tshams pa nye bar mi bsgrub pas sems can la phan 'dogs so //
translated: They benefit sentient beings by morality, since they do not inflict harm, poverty, or violence on them.üîΩThey benefit sentient beings by patience, since they tolerate those who inflict harm, poverty, and violence on them.

original: bzod pas ni gnod pa dang / phongs pa dang / rnam par tho 'tshams pa de dag la ji mi snyam par bzod pas sems can la phan thogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzhi pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: bzod pas ni gnod pa dang / phongs pa dang / rnam par tho 'tshams pa de dag la ji mi snyam par bzod pas sems can la phan thogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bzhi pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: This is the teaching of the four in order, as indicated by the words beginning with ‚ÄúThus.‚Äù

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: dang po phan 'dogs pa gsum bstan pa dang / phyi ma gnyen por gyur pa gsum pa bstan pa ste /

original: 'di ni dang po sems can la phan 'dogs pa gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po sems can la phan 'dogs pa gsum bstan pa'o //

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par 'grel pa'i mdo la sogs pa las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par 'grel pa'i mdo la sogs pa las /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and so forth explain:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum ni go rims bzhin du phan 'dogs pa rnam pa gsum po yo byad nye bar bsgrubs nas phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa mi byed pas phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la lan bya ba'i sems med pas phan 'dogs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum ni go rims bzhin du phan 'dogs pa rnam pa gsum po yo byad nye bar bsgrubs nas phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa mi byed pas phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa la lan bya ba'i sems med pas phan 'dogs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The first three perfections are to be applied respectively to the three types of benefit: benefit by providing material necessities, benefit by not harming and benefit by being patient with harm.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The Treatise on Cognition-Only Establishes That All is MindüîΩsays:

analyzed: @31b gzhan yang dang po gsum ni sems can la phan 'dogs pa dag yin te /
translated: Moreover, the first three are benefits for sentient beings.

original: de dag la yo byad sbyin zhing de dag la gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / de dag gis gnod pa byas pa bzod cing phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /

analyzed: rgya cher ni bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //

original: phyi ma gsum nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par ma bcil /
analyzed: phyi ma gsum nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par ma bcil /

original: bag la nyal ba thams cad ma bcom par yang nan tan gyis dge ba'i phyogs rnams sgom par byed pas nyon mongs pa de dag gis dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i las bskyed par mi nus so //

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon to //

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal ba gtan du 'joms par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ni phyi ma gnyen por gyur pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal ba gtan du 'joms par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa ni phyi ma gnyen por gyur pa gsum bstan to //
translated: By means of their wisdom, they completely destroy the latent dispositions. This is the second, the teaching on the latter three as antidotes.

original: 'di ltar brtson 'grus de bsam gtan ltar kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par bcil ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtson 'grus de bsam gtan ltar kun tu spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par bcil ba yang ma yin /

analyzed: shes rab ltar sa bon bag la nyal ba thams cad gtan du bcom pa ma yin mod kyi /

original: 'on kyang brtson 'grus kyis dge ba rnams sgom par byed pa des nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi bskyed par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed do //üîΩdge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus yin te /

analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa rnam par gnon par byed la /

original: shes rab kyis ni sa bon gtan du 'joms pa'i phyir /

original: phyi ma gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phyi ma gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'o zhes bshad do //

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang /

original: rnam par bcil bar ma gyur kyang /
analyzed: rnam par bcil bar ma gyur kyang /

analyzed: nan tan gyis dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor zhing gnyen por bsgoms nas nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon cing nye bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste / rgya cher ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus @32a * //

translated: Since bodhisattvas experience physical and mental harm, they generate the thought of great compassion and generate the six perfections in order to pacify the suffering of the six kinds of migrators.üîΩThus they are neither too many nor too few.
