original: pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma gsum po dag go zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma gsum po dag go zhes 'byung ste /
translated: , which consists of the latter three perfections.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: This is taught extensively in that text.

original: 'di ni rkyen dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rkyen dang po'o //
translated: This is the first condition.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, in that same text, it says that the perfections are the means for attaining the nirvana that is not a location.

original: de'i grangs su drug kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i grangs su drug kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, their number is definitely six.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum gyi phyir ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum gyi phyir ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma gsum gyi phyir ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so // pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma gsum gyi phyir ni /
translated: The first three perfections are not a location for nirvana.

original: 'khor ba la mi gnas so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba la mi gnas so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The last three perfections are not a location for samsara.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te /üîΩ'di @33a * //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te / 'di @33a * //
translated: This is stated in detail in that same text.

original: ni rkyen gnyis pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang de nyid las sems can sdud cing phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ni rkyen gnyis pa'o // gzhan yang de nyid las sems can sdud cing phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the second condition.

original: grangs drug kho na'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: grangs drug kho na'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, in that same text, it says that their number is definitely six because they gather sentient beings and benefit them, and because they are the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: 'di ni mdo 'di nyid las gsum pa dang mthun par don rnam pa gnyis kyi drug tu gsungs par bstan te 'di ni rkyen rnam pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo 'di nyid las gsum pa dang mthun par don rnam pa gnyis kyi drug tu gsungs par bstan te 'di ni rkyen rnam pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third condition.

original: kha cig las ni don rnam pa bzhis mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni don rnam pa bzhis mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa yang yod de /
translated: In some s≈´tras, the number of perfections is taught as four, not more, not less.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Cognition-Only, it is taught as it is in the s≈´tras.

original: bstan bcos de nyid las ni don rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //üîΩdang po ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i grangs mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa la yang don rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bstan bcos de nyid las ni don rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to // dang po ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i grangs mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa la yang don rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In that same treatise, it is taught with three meanings.üîΩFirst, in teaching the number of ten perfections as not more, not less, there are two meanings:üîΩin order to eliminate the ten obscurations and in order to manifest the ten suchnesses.

original: sgrib pa bcu rab tu sel ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid bcu mngon du byed pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi grangs mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa yang don rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: sgrib pa bcu rab tu sel ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid bcu mngon du byed pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi grangs mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa yang don rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Second, in teaching the number of six perfections as not more, not less, there are four meanings:

original: dang po ni rgyu rnam pa gsum la brten nas ni mi mthun pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa drug rab tu sel ba'i phyir dang / rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sgrub pa'i phyir dang rim gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir te /üîΩzhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dang po ni rgyu rnam pa gsum la brten nas ni mi mthun pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa drug rab tu sel ba'i phyir dang / rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sgrub pa'i phyir dang rim gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir te / zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The first is based on three causes: because it eliminates six kinds of adverse obscurations, because it gradually accomplishes the qualities of buddhahood, and because it gradually brings sentient beings to full maturity.

original: gnyis pa ni lam gnyis la brten pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lam gnyis la brten pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is based on two paths:

original: mngon par mtho ba'i lam dang / nges par legs pa'i lam gang yin pa ste /üîΩchos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las rnam grangs dang po nas bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i lam dang / nges par legs pa'i lam gang yin pa ste / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las rnam grangs dang po nas bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: the path of high rebirth and the path of definite goodness.

original: gsum pa ni sems can la phan 'dogs shing sgrib pa rab tu sel ba dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sems can la phan 'dogs shing sgrib pa rab tu sel ba dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
translated: The third is in accord with the teachings in the sutra itself, which states that it benefits sentient beings and eliminates obscurations.

original: bzhi pa ni mi gnas pa'i lam gyis mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mi gnas pa'i lam gyis mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourth is taught in the non-abiding path, which is neither too much nor too little.

original: dang po gsum gyi phyir ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa dang / phyi ma gsum gyi phyir ni 'khor ba la mi gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dang po gsum gyi phyir ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa dang / phyi ma gsum gyi phyir ni 'khor ba la mi gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The first three are the reasons for not dwelling in nirvana, and the last three are the reasons for not dwelling in samsara.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in the Compendium of the Great Vehicle.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle teaches

original: dang po gsum kho na ston te /
analyzed: dang po gsum kho na ston te /
translated: only the first three.

original: rim gyis sgrib pa rab tu sel ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis sgrib pa rab tu sel ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: They are the gradual elimination of obscurations, the accomplishment of the qualities of buddhahood, and the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun @33b las btus pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa sna tshogs kun @33b las btus pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Abhidharma teaches

original: phyi ma gsum kho na'i don dang / lam rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: phyi ma gsum kho na'i don dang / lam rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa ston to //
translated: only the last three, the meaning of the two kinds of paths, and so forth.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni bstan bcos gnyis kyi don ni spyir bsdus nas rnam pa drug tu bstan pa'i phyir rkyen bzhir gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni bstan bcos gnyis kyi don ni spyir bsdus nas rnam pa drug tu bstan pa'i phyir rkyen bzhir gyur pa yin no //
translated: In the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only, the meaning of the two treatises is summarized and taught in six topics, and thus it is a commentary on the four conditions.

original: yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: In the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only,

original: rkyen rnam pa drug tu phye nas ston te /
analyzed: rkyen rnam pa drug tu phye nas ston te /
translated: The conditions are taught by dividing them into six types,

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum logs shig tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa las bstan pa'i rgyu rnam pa gsum logs shig tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the three causes taught in the Compendium of the Great Vehicle are divided separately.

original: mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni ji skad du bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The two conditions taught in this sutra are as they are taught in the Abhidharma treatise Compendium of All the Dharmas and the Proof of Consciousness Only.

original: de brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you examine them, you will understand.

original: gsum pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi'i grangs mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi'i grangs mi mang mi nyung bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The third is the teaching that the number of the four perfections is neither more nor less.

original: mdo'i tshig thad kar bcas pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig thad kar bcas pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: This should be explained in the sutra itself.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni tshigs su bcad pa drug gis drug tu rnam par gzhag pa'i gtan tshigs ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni tshigs su bcad pa drug gis drug tu rnam par gzhag pa'i gtan tshigs ston te /
translated: In the treatise Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, the six are presented by way of six verses that teach the reasons for the six.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i gzhi rnam pa gsum bsdu ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam pa drug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gzhi rnam pa drug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi bsdu ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i gzhi rnam pa gsum bsdu ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rnam pa drug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gzhi rnam pa drug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi bsdu ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it includes the three bases of benefit for oneself, because it includes the six aspects of benefit for oneself and others, because it includes the six bases of benefit for oneself and others, and because it includes the four causes of the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po'i lam drug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i bslab pa gsum bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lam drug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i bslab pa gsum bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it includes the six paths of the Great Vehicle, because it includes the three trainings of the Great Vehicle,

original: brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur bas zhib tu ma bshad do //
analyzed: brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur bas zhib tu ma bshad do //
translated: because it is to be understood by investigation. Therefore, I will not explain it in detail.üîΩAvalokite≈õvara Bodhisattva also said to the Blessed One:

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhi kho nar mdzad par gdags lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma bzhi'i grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhi kho nar mdzad par gdags lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma bzhi'i grangs 'phel 'grib med par bstan pa'o //
translated: From here on is the second, showing the non-increase and non-decrease of the latter four perfections.

original: de bzhi bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhi bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: Those four are the ten perfections, and these four latter perfections are:

original: thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes so //
analyzed: thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes so //
translated: means, aspiration, power, and knowledge.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan @34a * //üîΩdu gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan @34a * // du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po grangs bzhi'i gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po grangs bzhi'i gtan tshigs zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the first request for the reason for the four numbers.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Avalokite≈õvara:

original: rigs kyi bu snga ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu snga ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is because the latter six perfections are the companions of the former six perfections.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This is the second reply, which shows the Tathagata's correct reply.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis las grangs bzhi las mi mang mi nyung ba'i lan mdor bstan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi'i grangs mi nyung mi mang bar gyur pa'i don rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis las grangs bzhi las mi mang mi nyung ba'i lan mdor bstan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi'i grangs mi nyung mi mang bar gyur pa'i don rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is a brief presentation of the reply with four aspects, neither more nor less, and an explanation that analyzes the meaning of the four perfections, neither less nor more.

original: 'di ni dang por grangs bzhir nges pa'i gtan tshigs mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang por grangs bzhir nges pa'i gtan tshigs mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief presentation of the reason for the definite number of four.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa drug po dag gi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa drug po dag gi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi kho na ste /
translated: Because they are the companions of the six aspects, there are just four aspects,

original: mi mang mi nyung ngo //
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung ngo //
translated: neither more nor less.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Establishing Mere Representation,üîΩit is said:

original: phyi ma bzhi kho nar gyur pa yang snga ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi grogs su gyur cing yongs su rdzogs par byed pas mi nyung mi mang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi ma bzhi kho nar gyur pa yang snga ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi grogs su gyur cing yongs su rdzogs par byed pas mi nyung mi mang ba'i phyir /
translated: The last four are the aids of the former six perfections and they complete them.

original: thabs la mkhas pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum gyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum gyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Skill in means is the aid of the first three perfections, generosity and so on.

original: smon lam ni brtson 'grus kyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: smon lam ni brtson 'grus kyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Vows are the aid of the fourth perfection, diligence.

original: stobs ni bsam gtan gyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: stobs ni bsam gtan gyi grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Power is the aid of the fifth perfection, concentration.

original: ye shes ni shes rab kyi grogs su gyur pa yin te so so nas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes ni shes rab kyi grogs su gyur pa yin te so so nas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And knowledge is the aid of the sixth perfection, wisdom.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can gang yin pa bsdu pa'i dngos por zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba'i phyogs la 'jog par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can gang yin pa bsdu pa'i dngos por zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba'i phyogs la 'jog par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas, by means of the first three perfections, gather beings to themselves by means of the means of attraction and they establish them in virtue.

original: la go rims bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po dag rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: la go rims bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po dag rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: The four perfections are distinguished and explained in order.

original: 'di yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid kyis rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid kyis rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into four parts by the very explanation of the distinction of the four perfections.

original: 'di ni dang po thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyi grogs su gyur par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyi grogs su gyur par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the perfection of means, which is taught to be the companion of the previous three perfections.

original: re re la yang rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: re re la yang rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: Each is taught with an explanation and a conclusion.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma gsum la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa phyi ma gsum la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the following three perfections.

original: 'di dang po thabs rnam pa gsum gyi @34b grogs su gyur pa nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dang po thabs rnam pa gsum gyi @34b grogs su gyur pa nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the first, which is the companion of the three types of means.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag bsdu ba'i dngos po thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung nas dge ba'i phyogs la 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag bsdu ba'i dngos po thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung nas dge ba'i phyogs la 'jog par byed do //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas, having attracted beings who are gathered by the first three perfections, establish them in virtue by means of the means of attraction.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po de yang thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis spyir yongs su bzung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po de yang thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis spyir yongs su bzung ba la bya'o //
translated: And that means of attraction is generally considered to be the means of attraction by various methods.

original: mtshams rnam par grol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes 'byung gi bzhi zhes pa ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par grol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes 'byung gi bzhi zhes pa ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Vimuktimarga Sutra and the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, the means of attraction is mentioned, but not the four.

original: yang na bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the means of attraction is the four means of attraction.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can gang yin pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis dge ba la 'jog par byed ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma gsum gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can gang yin pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis dge ba la 'jog par byed ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Those sentient beings who are included in the first three perfections are established in virtue by the four means of attraction.üîΩTherefore, I have taught that the perfection of skillful means is the companion of the first three.

original: de'i phyir ngas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snga ma gsum po dag gi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni snga ma gsum po dag gi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu pa bstan te /
translated: This is the second explanation, the conclusion.

original: brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is merely a convention.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams mthong ba'i chos la nyon mongs pa mang ba'i phyir /

original: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed pa dang mchog tu rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa bskyed pa dang mchog tu rab tu zhi ba /
translated: that is supremely peaceful,

original: rlom sems dang bral ba /
analyzed: rlom sems dang bral ba /
translated: free from conceit,

original: ro myang ba med pa /
analyzed: ro myang ba med pa /
translated: free from savoring,

original: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /üîΩde dag gi tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni / de dag gi tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and free from all signs.üîΩThis should be known as the bodhisattvas‚Äô concentration of abiding in bliss in this life.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mngon par bsgrubs pa'i bsam gtan ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mngon par bsgrubs pa'i bsam gtan ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The concentration of accomplishing the qualities of meditative absorption is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing tshad med par sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab cing tshad med par sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the meditative absorption whose name even the listeners and solitary realizers do not know, let alone their resting in it.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Meditative absorption for the benefit of sentient beings is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gyi bya ba dang ldan pa dag la grogs su 'gro ba dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / rigs pa ston pa dang / byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor te phan 'dogs pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gyi bya ba dang ldan pa dag la grogs su 'gro ba dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / rigs pa ston pa dang / byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor te phan 'dogs pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas, in dependence on meditative stabilization, act as friends to those who have the activities of sentient beings, they dispel the suffering of suffering sentient beings, they teach the rational system, they repay the kindness of those who have helped them and they repay the kindness of those who have benefited them.

original: 'jigs pa rnams las byung ba dang / yo byad med pa rnams la yo byad stobs pa dang / yang dag pa'i 'khor legs par sdud pa dang / sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams kyis dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jigs pa rnams las byung ba dang / yo byad med pa rnams la yo byad stobs pa dang / yang dag pa'i 'khor legs par sdud pa dang / sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan rnams kyis dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: They rescue those who are frightened, they give necessities to those who lack necessities, they gather a retinue properly, they engage in activities in accordance with their minds, they delight them with their excellent qualities,

original: legs par tshar gcod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par byed pa dang / 'dun par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: legs par tshar gcod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis skrag par byed pa dang / 'dun par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: they properly subdue them, they frighten them with their miracles and they inspire them.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Bodhisattva Levels.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzod pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzod pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Vasubandhu's Treasury of Knowledge Autocommentary says:

original: bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba 'di ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par byed do //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba 'di ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par byed do //
translated: The concentration of abiding in bliss is the cause of abiding in bliss in this life.

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa drug mngon par sgrub par byed do //üîΩbya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba 'di ni sems can la phan @44a * //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa drug mngon par sgrub par byed do // bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba 'di ni sems can la phan @44a * //
translated: The concentration of accomplishing activities is the cause of accomplishing the six higher perceptions.

original: 'dogs pa'i bya ba dag mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i bya ba dag mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: The concentration of accomplishing activities is the cause of accomplishing activities that benefit sentient beings.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master BhƒÅviveka‚Äôs commentary explains:

original: gnas pa'i bsam gtan ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bsam gtan ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The concentration of abiding is for abiding in bliss in this life.

original: nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / sred pa la sogs pa spangs nas rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / sred pa la sogs pa spangs nas rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of attaining purity by abandoning pride, views, craving, and so on.

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan ni mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan ni mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentration of accomplishing activities is for accomplishing the special qualities such as the six higher perceptions.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan ni sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir mu ge dang nad kyi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan ni sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir mu ge dang nad kyi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The concentration of achieving activities is for the sake of benefiting sentient beings, in order to pacify the fears of famine, disease, and so on.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The Abhidharma treatise Compendium of All Doctrines states:

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa ni go rims bzhin du yongs su 'dzin pa gsum po yongs su ngal ba med pa dang / bsam pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa dang /üîΩ'khor 'dul ba'i las dang sbyar ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa ni go rims bzhin du yongs su 'dzin pa gsum po yongs su ngal ba med pa dang / bsam pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa dang / 'khor 'dul ba'i las dang sbyar ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The three kinds of complete acceptance are, respectively, for the sake of abiding in comfort in this life, for the sake of accomplishing the superknowledges, and for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las kyang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las kyang /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna states:

original: phal cher slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: phal cher slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: For the most part, it is explained in accordance with the teachings in the commentary composed by master Vasubandhu.

original: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: Fearing too many words, I will not write more here.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
translated: The treatise Ornament of Mahayana Sutras teaches three types:

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab dang ; don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'i shes rab po zhes bya ba ni drug pa shes rab rnam pa gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab dang ; don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'i shes rab po zhes bya ba ni drug pa shes rab rnam pa gsum bstan pa'o //
translated: The three types of wisdom are wisdom that focuses on conventional truth, wisdom that focuses on ultimate truth and wisdom that focuses on the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds explains:

original: shes rab rnam pa gnyis so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gnyis so zhes bshad do //
translated: Wisdom is twofold.

original: dang po shes rab gsum ni shes bya la de kho na nyid du khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba'i shes rab rig pa'i gnas lnga po rnams dang / tshogs gsum la mkhas pa'i shes rab dang / sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i shes rab po zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dang po shes rab gsum ni shes bya la de kho na nyid du khong du chud cing rtogs par bya ba'i shes rab rig pa'i gnas lnga po rnams dang / tshogs gsum la mkhas pa'i shes rab dang / sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i shes rab po zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The first three types of wisdom are the wisdom of the five topics of knowledge, which is wisdom that is comprehended and realized in terms of the nature of objects of knowledge; the wisdom of expertise in the three collections of scriptures; and the wisdom that benefits all sentient beings.

original: dang po ni de kho na nyid la @44b dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni de kho na nyid la @44b dmigs pa'o //
translated: The first is the observation of reality.

original: bar ma ni rang gi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma ni rang gi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The middle is the observation of one's own aim.

original: tha ma ni kun rdzob la dmigs shing gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni kun rdzob la dmigs shing gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The last is the observation of the conventional, and the benefitting of others.

original: de la rig pa'i gnas lnga ni nang gi rig pa la sogs te lnga po dag go //üîΩtshogs gsum ni don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang / don dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de la rig pa'i gnas lnga ni nang gi rig pa la sogs te lnga po dag go // tshogs gsum ni don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs dang / don dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The five sciences are the five beginning with the inner science.

original: don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The three collections are the collection of the teachings which have meaning, the collection of the teachings which do not have meaning, and the collection of the teachings which both have and do not have meaning.

original: de la shes rab kyi phyi ma gsum ni chos bdag med pa zab mo shes pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi phyi ma gsum ni chos bdag med pa zab mo shes pa'i shes rab po //
translated: The last three of the five sciences are the wisdom which knows the profound selflessness of phenomena,

original: sems can rnams 'dul ba'i thabs shes pa'i shes rab dang / shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa shes pa'i shes rab po zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'dul ba'i thabs shes pa'i shes rab dang / shes bya thams cad la sgrib pa med pa shes pa'i shes rab po zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the wisdom which knows the means of disciplining sentient beings, and the wisdom which knows all objects of knowledge without obscuration.

original: dang po ni chos stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni chos stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The first is the knowledge of the emptiness of phenomena.

original: bar ma ni gang zag stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma ni gang zag stong pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The middling is the knowledge of the emptiness of the person.

original: tha ma ni stong pa nyid gnyis mngon du byas pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni stong pa nyid gnyis mngon du byas pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The final is the knowledge of the realization of the two kinds of emptiness.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni sems can stong pa dang / chos stong pa dang / gnyi ga stong pa'i shes rab ces bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni sems can stong pa dang / chos stong pa dang / gnyi ga stong pa'i shes rab ces bshad do //
translated: In the treatise Establishing Cognition Only, it is explained as the wisdom of the emptiness of sentient beings, the emptiness of phenomena, and the emptiness of both.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni sbyor ba'i shes pa dang / rjes thob pa'i shes pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ni sbyor ba'i shes pa dang / rjes thob pa'i shes pa zhes bshad do //
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, it is explained as the knowledge of application and the knowledge of post-equipoise.

original: bstan bcos ngo bo nyid med pa gsum bstan pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos ngo bo nyid med pa gsum bstan pa las /
translated: In the treatise Teaching the Three Non-Natures,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'i shes rab ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'i shes rab ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the wisdom of nonconceptual application is as follows.

original: de kho na nyid bsgom pa mdun rol gyi thabs khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsgom pa mdun rol gyi thabs khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes rab po //
translated: It is the wisdom of the special method that precedes the meditation on suchness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The wisdom of nonconceptuality is as follows.

original: de kho na nyid du bsgom pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du bsgom pa'i shes rab po //
translated: It is the wisdom of the meditation on suchness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa phyis thob pa'i shes rab ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa phyis thob pa'i shes rab ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The wisdom of post-equipoise nonconceptuality is as follows.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' kun rdzob rnams shes pa chos ston pa la sogs pa dngos po sna tshogs ston pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' kun rdzob rnams shes pa chos ston pa la sogs pa dngos po sna tshogs ston pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The end of clear realization is the teaching of the Dharma, etc.

original: bstan bcos kun las btus pa las ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / sems can la dmigs pa'i shes rab dag ni rim bzhin du sa la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa'i ston pa gsum dang sbyar ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos kun las btus pa las ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / sems can la dmigs pa'i shes rab dag ni rim bzhin du sa la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa'i ston pa gsum dang sbyar ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The Compendium of the Universal Vehicle states that the wisdom which focuses on the conventional and the wisdom which focuses on sentient beings are respectively applied to the three instructions for entering the stages, for accomplishing the qualities of the Buddha, and for accomplishing the deeds of the Buddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po re re la yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gsum yod pa rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / rnam @45a * //üîΩpar bshad pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po re re la yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gsum yod pa rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / rnam @45a * // par bshad pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Each of the six perfections has three divisions. The extensive analysis is found in the commentary on the Compendium of the Universal Vehicle, translated by Lagu, and in the Vyakhyayukti.

original: mangs kyis dogs nas ma brjod do //
analyzed: mangs kyis dogs nas ma brjod do //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not write more.

original: de phyir bstan pa rnams de ltar tha dad par gyur ce na /
analyzed: de phyir bstan pa rnams de ltar tha dad par gyur ce na /
translated: Therefore, why are the teachings differentiated in that way?

original: don rnam pa gcig kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gcig kho na ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is not just one,

original: so so nas don re re smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so so nas don re re smos pa'i phyir /
translated: because each one mentions a different meaning.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba med do //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag mdo tsam du bstan pa yang /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba med do // pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag mdo tsam du bstan pa yang /
translated: There is no contradiction among them.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du /
translated: The nature of the six perfections is taught in brief in the Treatise on the Establishment of Authority.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang /
translated: The nature of the ten perfections

original: sbyin pa ni ma chags pa dang / des bskyed pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni ma chags pa dang / des bskyed pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: is generosity, which is the nature of nonattachment and the three actions it generates.

original: tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Morality is the nature of the three actions of taking up the bodhisattva vow.

original: bzod pa ni zhe sdang med pa dang brtson 'grus dang nges pa'i shes rab dang de dag gis bskyed pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bzod pa ni zhe sdang med pa dang brtson 'grus dang nges pa'i shes rab dang de dag gis bskyed pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Patience is the nature of nonhatred, effort, definite wisdom, and the three actions they generate.

original: brtson 'grus ni rtsol ba dang / des bskyed pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni rtsol ba dang / des bskyed pa'i las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Effort is the nature of the three actions generated by it.

original: bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Meditation is the nature of concentration.

original: phyi ma lnga ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: phyi ma lnga ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The last five are the nature of the discernment of that.

original: de'i rtsa ba dang / phyis thob pa'i yi shes so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba dang / phyis thob pa'i yi shes so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said that the root of that is the knowledge of the first stage, and the subsequent knowledge is the knowledge of the other stages.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu pa /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o / // / bam po drug cu pa /
translated: The extensive analysis should be understood according to the explanations of the characteristics.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara again said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa de dag pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni brgyad pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa de dag pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni brgyad pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The section beginning with Bhagavan, why are these perfections called perfections? teaches the eighth chapter, called The Explanation of the Attainment of the Name Perfection.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
translated: This also teaches the request and the answer.

original: de ni dang po ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes zhu ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dang po ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes zhu ba'o //
translated: The request is Why are they called perfections?

original: spyi dang bye brag gi ming ni gong du bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag gi ming ni gong du bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The general and specific names are as taught above.

original: 'di ni rgyu dang rkyen gang gi phyir dang / don gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa lnga'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin @45b gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston te /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni dang po chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o // pha rol tu @46a * //

analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang chags pa med pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi 'bras bu ni 'og nas mdo las bstan pa @46b bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The results of the six perfections should be understood as they are taught in the sutras.

analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang /

original: de la mi lta ba nyid ni 'di lta ste /

translated: Not being concerned with material reward means that one‚Äôs mind is not concerned with receiving something in return.

analyzed: mtshams rnam par grol ba'i mdo las mi lta ba nyid ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / da ltar gyi rnyed pa la sems 'brel pa med ba gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Not looking for rewards means that one‚Äôs mind is not concerned with the karmic fruit of the perfections or with present-day gain.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /

translated: The absence of hope is the absence of the thought of seeking the result of the perfections, their evolutionary development, and their enjoyment.

analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las / mi lta ba rnam par dag pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las ni rang gi lus dang / lan du phan 'dogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Arya-prajnaparamita-vajracchedika-tika says, ‚ÄúIt is the absence of attachment to one‚Äôs own body, the enjoyment of the results, and their evolutionary development.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The Yogacarya-bhumi-sastra says,

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa'i le'u las /

analyzed: lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bar sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re ba med de /

analyzed: lta la / byang chub mchog la ni phan yon du lta ba'i phyir sbyin pa gtong ngo zhes 'byung ste /

analyzed: 'di dag gi mtshan nyid rgya cher bshad pa ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon yon tan byin gyis mdzad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the characteristics of these perfections should be understood according to the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu and the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom Diamond Cutter composed by Master Gunaprabha.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the absence of reproach is as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang ma 'dres shing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang ma 'dres shing /
translated: Those perfections are not mixed with defiled phenomena,

analyzed: thabs ma yin pa'i spyod pa rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //

analyzed: 'og nas mdo las snying rje med pa'i sbyor ba la sogs ba skyon rnam pa bzhi bstan pa lta bu'o //
